question.body: Calculate pH of the initial 0.250 M HClO solution.

response.feedback:
Correct.
HClO + H
2
O ⇌ H
3
O
+
+ ClO
-
initial
0.250 M
------
0 M
0 M

-
x
-----
+
x

x
x
Assuming
x
<< 0.250.
$$\begin{array}{l}K_a\;=\;\frac{x^2}{0.250}\;=\;2.9\times10^{-8}\;\\x\;=\;8.51\times10^{-5}\;=\;\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;-\log\;(8.51\times10^{-5})\;=\;4.070\end{array}$$
Incorrect. Review the hint and try again.

Incorrect.

part.hint:
HClO, a weak acid, dissociates to form H
3
O
+
and ClO
-
according the reaction:
$$\mathrm{HClO}(aq)\;+\;{\mathrm H}_2\mathrm O(l)\;\;\rightleftharpoons\;\;{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+(aq)\;+\;\mathrm{ClO}^-(aq)$$
Use an ICE table to determine relative equilibrium concentrations of the HClO, H
3
O
+
and ClO
-
. Then use the
K
a
expression to determine [H
3
O
+
]eq.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Review the hints and try again.

part.hint:
The equivalence point is the point at with [H
3
O
+
] = [OH
-
].

Calculate the number of moles of H
3
O
+
that can be produced from the dissociation of 25.0 mL of the 0.250 M HClO. Determine the volume of 0.200 M NaOH that will contain the same number of moles of OH
-
.

body.p: We now recognize that 25.00 mL is before the equivalence point, 31.25 is at the equivalence point, and 35.00 is after the equivalence point.
Calculate the pH at each volume of titrant added.

response.feedback:
Correct.
HClO + OH
-
→ ClO
-
+ H
2
O
Before Addition of Titrant
0.00625 mol
0 mol
0 mol
----
Addition of Titrant
0 mol
0.00500 mol
0 mol
----
After Addition of Titrant
0.00125 mol
0 mol
0.00500 mol
----
$$\begin{array}{l}\mathrm{total}\;\mathrm{volume}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{titrant}\;\mathrm{is}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{is}\;50.00\;\mathrm{mL}\\\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00125}{0.0500}\;=\;0.0250\;\mathrm M\\\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00500}{0.0500}\;=\;0.100\;\mathrm M\\K_a\;=\frac{\;\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack}{\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack}\;=\;2.9\times10^{-8}\\\frac{\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack(0.100\;\mathrm M)}{(0.0250\;\mathrm M)}\;=\;2.9\times10^{-8}\\\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack\;=\;7.25\times10^{-9}\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;-\log\;(7.25\times10^{-9})\;=\;8.14\\\end{array}$$
Incorrect. Review the hints and try again.

Incorrect.
HClO + OH
-
→ ClO
-
+ H
2
O
Before Addition of Titrant

0 mol

0 mol
0.00500 mol
0 mol

After Addition of Titrant
0.00125 mol
0 mol
0.00500 mol
----
$$\begin{array}{l}\mathrm{total}\;\mathrm{volume}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{titrant}\;\mathrm{is}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{is}\;50.00\;\mathrm{mL}\\\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00125}{0.0500}\;=\;0.0250\;\mathrm M\\\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00500}{0.0500}\;=\;0.100\;\mathrm M\\K_a\;=\frac{\;\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack}{\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack}\;=\;2.9\times10^{-8}\\\frac{\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack(0.100\;\mathrm M)}{(0.0250\;\mathrm M)}\;=\;2.9\times10^{-8}\\\lbrack{\mathrm H}_3\mathrm O^+\rbrack\;=\;7.25\times10^{-9}\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;-\log\;(7.25\times10^{-9})\;=\;8.14\\\end{array}$$

part.hint:
Once the strong base (OH
-
) is added to the weak acid solution, the OH
-
will react with HClO to produce additional ClO
-
, thereby decreasing the amount of HClO and increasing the amount of ClO
-
. The reaction of significance here is:
$$\mathrm{HClO}(aq)\;+\;\mathrm{OH}^-(aq)\;\;\rightarrow\;\;\mathrm{ClO}^-(aq)\;+\;{\mathrm H}_2\mathrm O(l)$$

Calculate the moles of HClO after the OH
-
is added and the moles ClO
-
after the OH
-
is added. Using the total volume determine the concentrations of each. Then use the
K
a
expression to determine [H
3
O
+
] and finally pH.

response.feedback:
Correct.
$$\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00625\;\mathrm{mol}}{(0.02500\;\mathrm L\;+\;0.03125\;\mathrm L)}\;=\;0.111\;\mathrm M$$
ClO
-
+ H
2
O ⇌ HClO + OH
-
initial
0.111 M
------
0 M
0 M
change
-
x
-----
+
x
+
x
equilibrium
0.111 M -
x
-----
x
x
$$\begin{array}{l}K_{\mathrm a(\mathrm{HClO})}\;\times\;K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;K_w\\2.9\times10^{-8}\;\times K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;1.0\times10^{-14}\\K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;3.448\times10^{-7}\\K_b\;=\frac{\;\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack}{\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack}\\3.448\times10^{-7}\;=\;\frac{x^2}{0.111\;\mathrm M}\;(\mathrm{assuming}\;\mathrm x\;\mathrm{much}\;\mathrm{less}\;\mathrm{than}\;0.111)\\\mathrm x\;=\;1.956\times10^{-4}\;=\;\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\\\mathrm{pOH}\:=\;-\log\;(\;1.956\times10^{-4})\;=\;3.708\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;14.00\;-\;3.708\;=\;10.291\;\end{array}$$
Incorrect. Review the hints and try again.

Correct.
$$\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{0.00625\;\mathrm{mol}}{(0.02500\;\mathrm L\;+\;0.03125\;\mathrm L)}\;=\;0.111\;\mathrm M$$

$$\begin{array}{l}K_{\mathrm a(\mathrm{HClO})}\;\times\;K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;K_w\\2.9\times10^{-8}\;\times K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;1.0\times10^{-14}\\K_{\mathrm b(\mathrm{ClO}-)}\;=\;3.448\times10^{-7}\\K_b\;=\frac{\;\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\lbrack\mathrm{HClO}\rbrack}{\lbrack\mathrm{ClO}^-\rbrack}\\3.448\times10^{-7}\;=\;\frac{x^2}{0.111\;\mathrm M}\;(\mathrm{assuming}\;\mathrm x\;\mathrm{much}\;\mathrm{less}\;\mathrm{than}\;0.111)\\\mathrm x\;=\;1.956\times10^{-4}\;=\;\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\\\mathrm{pOH}\:=\;-\log\;(\;1.956\times10^{-4})\;=\;3.708\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;14.00\;-\;3.708\;=\;10.291\;\end{array}$$

part.hint:
At the equivalence point for this titration, the initial amount of HClO and OH
-
have been completely neutralized. However, the ClO
-
produced will react with H
2
O to form the weak acid and OH
-
, according to the following reaction:
$$\mathrm{ClO}^-\;+\;{\mathrm H}_2\mathrm O\;\;\rightleftharpoons\;\;\mathrm{OH}^-\;+\;\mathrm{HClO}$$

First the moles and then concentration of ClO
-
produced given the amounts of analyte and titrant must be determined. An ICE chart can be used to determine relative equilibrium concentrations of the species and then the
K
b
expression can be used to calculate [OH
-
]
eq
and then pOH and pH.

response.feedback:
Correct.
$$\begin{array}{l}\mathrm{volume}\;\mathrm{of}\;\mathrm{NaOH}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{equivalence}\;\mathrm{point}\;=\;35.00\;-\;31.25\;=\;3.75\;\mathrm{mL}\\\mathrm{moles}\;\;\mathrm{NaOH}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{equivalence}\;\mathrm{point}\;=\;0.200\;{\textstyle\frac{\mathrm{mol}}{\mathrm L}}\;\times\;0.00375\;\mathrm L\;=\;7.50\times10^{-4}\;\mathrm{mol}\end{array}$$
H
3
O
+
+ OH
-
→ 2 H
2
O
At the Equivalence Point
0 mol
0 mol
----
Addition after Eq. Pt.
0 mol
7.5×10
-4
mol
----
After Addition
0 mol
7.5×10
-4
mol
----
$$\begin{array}{l}\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{7.5\times10^{-4}\;\mathrm{mol}}{(0.02500\;\mathrm L\;+\;0.03500\;\mathrm L)}\;=\;0.125\;\mathrm M\\\mathrm{pOH}\:=\;-\log\;(\;0.125\;)\;=\;1.903\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;14.00\;-\;1.903\;=\;12.097\end{array}$$
Incorrect. Review the hint and try again.

Incorrect.
$$\begin{array}{l}\mathrm{volume}\;\mathrm{of}\;\mathrm{NaOH}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{equivalence}\;\mathrm{point}\;=\;35.00\;-\;31.25\;=\;3.75\;\mathrm{mL}\\\mathrm{moles}\;\;\mathrm{NaOH}\;\mathrm{added}\;\mathrm{after}\;\mathrm{the}\;\mathrm{equivalence}\;\mathrm{point}\;=\;0.200\;{\textstyle\frac{\mathrm{mol}}{\mathrm L}}\;\times\;0.00375\;\mathrm L\;=\;7.50\times10^{-4}\;\mathrm{mol}\end{array}$$

7.5×10
-4
mol

$$\begin{array}{l}\lbrack\mathrm{OH}^-\rbrack\;=\;\frac{7.5\times10^{-4}\;\mathrm{mol}}{(0.02500\;\mathrm L\;+\;0.03500\;\mathrm L)}\;=\;0.125\;\mathrm M\\\mathrm{pOH}\:=\;-\log\;(\;0.125\;)\;=\;1.903\\\mathrm{pH}\;=\;14.00\;-\;1.903\;=\;12.097\end{array}$$

part.hint:
After the equivalence point, all of the moles of HClO have been neutralized. The moles of titrant (OH
-
) added after the equivalence point will be used to calculate the pH. Note that the moles of ClO
-
present affect on pH is insignificant compared to the OH
-
added. Calculating the pH after the equivalence point is the same for a weak acid-strong base titration as it was for a strong acid-strong base titration.
